101.description: In this session, we will take a look at Windows and .NET support on Google Cloud Platform. We will build a simple ASP.NET app, deploy to Google Compute Engine and take a look at some of the tools and APIs available to .NET developers on Google Cloud Platform.
101.title: Windows and .NET on Google Cloud Platform

102.description:
Do you remember the game Simon says from the 80s? I don’t know about you, but I know many that spent hours trying to press those specific sequences of red, green, blue and yellow buttons in the correct order. But why play on your own? We’ve implemented a gRPC server that allows you to play Simon with other players over the internet!

In this workshop we will dive into the toolset and libraries to build your very own Simon Says client for this server. We will have a message description in Protocol Buffers format and some stub code in several languages ready for you to play with. The goal for this workshop is for you to have a working client that you can use to play (and beat!) other attendees of the workshop.
102.title: Hands-on gRPC experience building your own multiplayer game client

103.description:
Doze mode is just around the corner. 
Introduced in Marshmallow, as the shy guy that was allowed to step in only when your device went to sleep. ZzzZzzzz
With the new N release, Doze mode becomes the rockstar. He rushes into the room with a big shabang by shooting all background services and network requests that forgot to get away. 
He should no longer be shy. He just shoots and dances on bones of your scheduled alarms, while you wonder why this particular task is no longer running.
With the new Doze mode, you require to adapt your app architecture to the new reality.
On this talk, we will learn how to survive Doze mode using Job Scheduler, Content Provider and stay in one piece.
103.title: Knock knock! Who's there? Doze.

104.description: It's no longer just about digitizing our environment. It’s rather about pervasive and ubiquitous computing. Almost all everyday things will turn into connected devices soon. This “Internet of Things” will allow the Web to be physically tangible. But what is the value, and how can one prevent IoT applications which just seem to be only more expensive and complicated than conventional solutions. Sascha will discuss the purpose and guide you through this complex topic showing inspiring solutions, tips from practice, and code samples in a variety of technologies from simple Bluetooth Eddystone Beacons to more sophisticated IoT platforms like Eclipse SmartHome.
104.title: The Physical Web: Context is King!

106.description: Fuelio. Success story (I'll write more info later)
106.title: Fuelio. Success story

107.description: There's been much discussion about Progressive Web Apps. They're still a relatively new model. In this talk, I'll summarise few options and techniques for getting started with your own Progressive Web App
107.title: Introduction to Progressive Web Apps in Angular 2

108.description: Angular 2 introduces a new Data Architecture based on Reactive Programming using RxJS 5. We are really excited to see the new approach using Observable sequences aka Observables. We will cover a basic introduction of Angular 2 followed by RxJS 5 and the new HTTP API covering some basic use cases.
108.title: New Data Architecture in Angular 2

109.title: How much money Firebase can save you

110.description: There's a lot of hype around MVP pattern in the Android world. Now it's time for concretes. During his presentation Mateusz will tell you how IG divided responsibilities between pattern's different components, how they tied Presenters' and Views' lifecycles and what they did to make it all testable. If you'd love to make your Fragments' and Activities' code simpler and increase your coverage, but you're confused how to glue it all together - don't miss Mateusz's talk.
110.title: The ultimate guide to MVP pattern on Android

111.description: It's beauty, it's handy, it's fast, it's easy - all about Dagger 2
111.title: Building modular architecture apps with Dagger 2

112.description: Last year brought a lot of new capabilities to browsers, fundamentally changing the way we will build web apps in 2016. 60FPS, push messages, offline support and background sync became a reality marking the birth of Progressive Web Apps.
112.title: Building web apps in 2016

113.description: Microservices is coming with a certain workload and constraints. Let's try to see how Google Cloud Platform and App Engine can help the overall microservices implementation.
113.title: Microservices in Google App Engine

114.description:
Storing account information is a common challenge many app developers face, and is often tackled in tailored solutions. Isn't there some strategy to store account credentials in a centralized place?

What about considerations for multiple accounts? Security concerns? And when should or could I synchronize data?

Android offers a powerful—and underrated—account manager. Let's explore the possibilities together and lay out an architecture for engineering an Android app based on accounts.
114.title: I’ve been doing some syncing…

115.description: Upcoming Android N release will bring some interesting changes to both Android run-time and toolchain. Let's talk about JIT, AOT, hybrid JIT/AOT, Jack, Jill and other acronyms and codenames ;-) In this presentation we'll see how many awesome tricks are needed to make our apps start fast and run smoothly on modern Android devices. Hopefully we'll also answer the most important question -- what's next for Android after Java.
115.title: Android tool-chain and run-time improvements in N

116.description:
One of my favourite things about the web are ASCII smileys. They're sweet, fun and simply make the web a better place. How could anyone not like them ¯(ツ)/¯?

This talk is an overdose of smileys, because they're the perfect excuse to get started with Polymer. Polymer is a library built on top of the Web Components standards that helps developers create reusable components for the modern web. And since I know that everybody has been wondering how one could take over the world by creating a suite of Polymer animated emoticon components, we're going to do exactly that.
116.title: On Polymer and smileys... or Polysmileys

117.description: Data is becoming one of the main decision-makers in an organisation. The more data we have the more challenges we face every day. Every decision we make will have long-term implications. In the talk we will go through different approaches to the data pipelines: from a simple in-house built, with comparison to open source solutions based on Apache stack(Apache Kafka, Apache Samza, Spark) and finally hosted auto-scaling solutions based Amazon(S3, Kinesis, Lambda, EMR) or Google(Pub/Sub, Dataflow, BigQuery). The talk covers the main aspects of data collecting processes altogether with further implications for data processing, highlighting appropriate solutions and architectures for the particular use-cases.
117.title: Building data pipelines: from simple to more advanced - hands-on experience

119.description:
Writing Android apps is usually fun because you are actually building something. But what about writing tests? Boring stuff. Errr, UI tests? I am a developer!

In this talk we will take a look at options for UI tests on Android, why you should write them and how they help you with your app development workflow. No more untested apps!
119.title: Hands-on with UI testing for Android developers

120.description: "Remember back when AJAX completely changed what was possible in the desktop web? Progressive web apps are that same fundamental shift for the mobile web." said Rahul Row-Chowdhury (Google’s product lead for chrome and the web platform) on stage at Google I/O 2016. - Progressive web apps use service workers, app shell, push notifications, RAIL and other capabilities to deliver an app-like user experience.
120.shortDescription: Progressive web apps are are fundamental shift for the mobile web, learn what they are and how they are made. Click to see more...
120.title: Progressive web apps - prepare your web for 2017

121.description: Using service workers and other modern progressive web apps capabilities we can update our web applications to be offline-fires. In this session we'll show how to easily convert your applications be usable without the internet connection.
121.title: Offline-first progressive web apps

122.description: I would like to talk about architecture of our Settle Up app. It's all based on new Firebase announced on I/O with the help of modern frameworks like Rx, Kotlin and MVP.
122.title: Firebase + Kotlin + RxJava + MVP: Practical Tips

124.description: You are tired of building every patch for your QA ? Still deploying to google play manually ? You still think that build server is something that you don't need ? Than I will try to show you how you can make life of your team easier with CI.
124.title: Continues Integration in Android

126.description: Imagine the world where you can get any application, look into its code (even if it is not open sourced) and modify any conditional operator in any way you like. Welcome, you are in the Android applications world! Let's discover how anyone can decompile your app and, for example, hack your 'if' operators. For the beginning, we will play a role of a script kiddie and try to hack some simple app. After this, we will pretend security-conscious Android developers and try to think how we can protect ourselves.
126.title: Android hacking for dummies: ‘if’ operator demolytion

127.description: If you have any experience with Android Media Player, you definitely know how hard it is to prepare it and do not lose your mind. ExoPlayer - is an alternative, which can help you deal with media with much less pain. So lets discuss if it really a "silver bullet" or yet another State Machine hell.
127.title: ExoPlayer: Media playback without pain (almost...)

128.description: Google announced Android Wear 2.0 become available this Fall. This major update brings some revolutionary changes in platform, that should change our approaches in developing wearable apps, including freedom of BLE tethering, system support for complications and activity recognition by GoogleFit, developed mainly for Android Wear 2.0. We will talk deeper about these new features and look at some ways to implement them in the code.
128.title: Android Wear 2.0: Great Changes Upcoming this Fall

129.description:
Accessibility is a very important step to make sure that your app reaches everyone in an easy and fun way to use. 
Good accessibility support means much more than just making sure the app supports screen readers, different fonts sizes and good contrast ratios. It is a learning process, and one in which we ourselves still have much to learn and explore.
129.title: Accessibility on Android

130.description:
Wearable devices are one of the most popular things nowadays. Specially, after the Apple Watch, we finally get the whole picture of the entire list of products and their features. Now, we can talk about how we can design a user experience for this type of devices.
Every platform has it's own design principles and approaches. But, in the core, they all need to follow same core rules. So, how we combine this core requirements with Google's Material Design and use them on an Android Wear device? Let's learn!
130.title: Designing an Android Wear Application

131.description:
In this talk, I will reveal you all the deepest secrets of using MVVM architecture in Android. 
We will discuss on how to organise your application, views, models, how to retrieve data from the model requested from the view via data binding. 
Lightweight Activities and Fragments, is it even possible? 

Yes, and I will show you how to achieve this with MVVM and DataBinding!
131.title: Deal with it: Android DataBinding explained

132.description: Get your badge, coffee, enjoy talking with tech edicts around
132.title: Registration & morning Coffee

136.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the organizers, sponsors and partners.
136.title: GDG DevFest Ukraine 2016 Opening

137.description: Afterparty is a great time to have some fun and meet new people
137.title: Afterparty & Networking

138.description: Make sure you won't miss closing ceremony, all gifts from out sponsors and partners will find their owners during this session.
138.title: Conference closing and contest winners announcements

Hiranya_Jayathilaka.bio: Hiranya is a tech lead on the Firebase team. He works on Firebase Admin SDKs that enable backend integrations of Firebase. Prior to joining Google, Hiranya worked as a software engineer at WSO2, where he developed open source enterprise integration and API management technologies. He is a committer for several Apache projects including Apache Synapse and Axis2. Hiranya earned a bachelor’s degree in engineering from University of Moratuwa, Sri Lanka. He also received a Ph.D. in computer science from UC Santa Barbara. Hiranya’s dissertation focuses on the governance of cloud applications via policies, SLOs and programming language techniques. He has published original research in numerous peer-reviewed journals and conferences specialized in cloud computing and web services.
Hiranya_Jayathilaka.name: Hiranya Jayathilaka
Hiranya_Jayathilaka.shortBio: Hiranya is a tech lead on the Firebase team. He works on Firebase Admin SDKs that enable backend integrations of Firebase.
Hiranya_Jayathilaka.title: Senior Software Engineer

Shweta_Bhatt.bio: Data Scientist, currently working in the AI team at Youplus, a startup based out of Bangalore and headquartered in New York City. She specializes in building a range of machine learning based products mostly within the NLP domain. She holds an undergraduate degree from Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani in Information Systems and a Master's degree from King's College London in Artificial Intelligence. She has previously worked as a Software Developer at Cisco Systems and Apigee (acquired by Google in 2016) before transitioning into her AI career. She also has research experience at King's College London within the NetSys and the Biostatistics & Health Informatics research groups and has a paper - Illuminating and ecosystem of partisan websites published at the Web Conference 2018. Apart from this, she likes to contribute to the ML community by writing tech blogs which have been published in KDnuggets and TowardsDataScience on Medium. She is a mentor at Springboard, an online learning platform, through which she helps aspiring learners get started with their Data Science and AI/ML careers. She is also an AI consultant for a retail startup called SprintAI. Her interests within AI include Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning and Game Theory.
Shweta_Bhatt.name: Shweta Bhatt
Shweta_Bhatt.shortBio: Data Scientist, currently working in the AI team at Youplus, a startup based out of Bangalore and headquartered in New York City. She specializes in building a range of machine learning based products mostly within the NLP domain.
Shweta_Bhatt.title: Data Scientist

keshan_sodimana.bio: Keshan is the former country engineering consultant for Google Sri Lanka. Keshan was the GDG lead and founder for GDG Sri Lanka. Before joining Google, he was a Software Developer for IFS, and he is a co-founder of Siyomek Holdings
keshan_sodimana.name: Keshan Sodimana
keshan_sodimana.shortBio: Keshan is the former country engineering consultant for Google for Sri Lanka. Keshan was the GDG lead and founder for GDG Sri Lanka. Before joining Google, he was a Software Developer for IFS, and he is a co-founder of Siyomek Holdings
keshan_sodimana.title: GDE Machine Learning

Sajeetharan_Sinnathurai.bio: With over 8 years of experience in the ICT industry, Sajeetharan Sinnathurai is a full stack developer, an enthusiast in Cloud and Web Development. He currently works at Microsoft as a Technical Evangelist. His skill in Web Application Architecture, Cloud and more has seen him become a Microsoft MVP in Developer Technologies, Google developer expert in Web technology. Sajeetharan is also the top contributor on stack Overflow in Sri Lanka and he ranks among the top 10 contributors in the world on Angular, Cosmos DB, etc. He is also a reviewer on https://www.packtpub.com/ .He now focuses on channeling his knowledge into open source projects and sharing it with the community by mentoring,creating POCS,running workshops,writing blogs to help make the world a better and more developed place.
Sajeetharan_Sinnathurai.name: Sajeetharan Sinnathurai
Sajeetharan_Sinnathurai.shortBio: Sajeetharan is a full stack developer with over 8 years of experience.
Sajeetharan_Sinnathurai.title: Cloud Solution Architect

Milindu_Sanoj.bio: Graduated with a BSc in Computer Science from University of Colombo School of Computing in 2017 and now working as a full-stack Software Engineer at Sysco Labs. Have been working with GDG Sri Lanka for about couple of years and now managing the GDG Cloud Sri Lanka chapter. Open source enthusiast and has contributed to Apache, Sahana and several other organisations.

Neha_Sharma.bio: Neha has 10 years of experience is UI domain. She has started designing and developing the web when IE6 was there. She survived IE6,7, and 8. Today she is working on web - Reactjs, Javascript, PWAs, and many more web technologies. She is active speaker and mentor in the community of India. You can check her own community work on JSLovers Meetup as well as her work as Github too. When she is not coding or speaking you can find her doing calligraphy.

Prior to that Kasun was a Senior Software Engineer at WSO2 which is a globally recognized middleware company. He worked in the mobile/iOT platform team where the focus was on delivering a complete suite of lean enterprise mobileware to solve the mobile computing challenges faced by enterprises.

Christina_Funk.bio: After graduating from Princeton University, Christina joined Cloud and Enterprise at Microsoft as a full stack developer, focusing on data and analytics. Last year, Christina moved to California to be a part of the Crowd 9 team in Research and Machine Intelligence at Google, where she works on creating new tools for data collection and annotation.
Christina_Funk.name: Christina Funk
Christina_Funk.title: Software Engineer

Hasitha_Liyanage.bio: Hasitha holds a B.Sc. in Computer Science and Engineering from the University of Moratuwa and has over 14 years of experience in the IT industry. He has expertise in design, architecture and development from his time at MillenniumIT, where he was a Software Architect. He was responsible for several systems ranging from high frequency trading systems for financial markets in the United States, Europe and Hong Kong, to electronic regulatory compliance systems for the Philippines and the International Labour Organization. Hasitha was also Chief Software Architect for Infoshare, and a Technology Consultant for thinkCube Systems, a digital services company specializing in cloud applications. At Sysco LABS, Hasitha heads the engineering & delivery for product engineering at SyscoLABS, leading a team of eighty engineers. Hasitha's scope includes product architecture, technology strategy, training, mentoring and skills development, project management, R&D, as well as engineering standards & processes.
Hasitha_Liyanage.name: Hasitha Liyanage
Hasitha_Liyanage.title: Senior Director, Technology and Architecture

Priyanka_Suduge.bio: Priyanka Suduge is a Principal Software Engineer at Pearson, working on mobile technologies. He was previously employed at Canon, Sony, Virtusa and MetaTechno Inc. Japan. He brings 13 years of industry experience on various technologies including mobile, real-time systems and firmware. He holds a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, and a Master's Degree in Software Architecture, both from University of Moratuwa.
Priyanka_Suduge.name: Priyanka Suduge
Priyanka_Suduge.title: Principal Software Engineer

Amalka_Pathirage.bio: Amalka has been in Software Engineering for about 10 years and most of his career is focused on mobile application development and in Android. He is also keen on other mobile platforms like Windows Mobile, and iOS. Amalka is a Technical Lead in Pearson working on mobile technologies.He holds a Bachelor's Degree in IT from SLIIT and a Master's Degree in Enterprise Application Development from Sheffield Hallam University.
Amalka_Pathirage.name: Amalka Pathirage
Amalka_Pathirage.title: Senior Technical Lead

Shafraz_Rahim.bio: Shafraz is a former developer relations manager for Dialog Ideamart and he has been in the industry for a long time with mobile app development and entrepreneurship as his talents.
Shafraz_Rahim.name: Shafraz Rahim

2017.title: Build an Interactive Customer Review System using Google NLP and Ideamart APIs

Shafraz_Rahim.title: Cloud Community Manager

Lucas_Dixon.bio: Lucas Dixon is Chief Scientist at Jigsaw. His work focuses on security, machine intelligence and data visualization. Public projects he helped build include uProxy, Project Shield, DigitalAttackMap, Syria Defection Tracker, and unfiltered.news. He currently leads the Conversation AI research effort. Before Google and Jigsaw, Lucas was a scientist at the University of Edinburgh and worked on the automation of mathematical thinking, graphical languages to describe quantum information, and technology to enable more rational and informed debate. He was a co-founder of TheoryMine Ltd., a company automates the discovers new non-trivial mathematical theorems. He received his PhD in Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence from the University of Edinburgh.
Lucas_Dixon.name: Lucas Dixon
Lucas_Dixon.title: Chief Scientist

Michael_Tseng.bio: After completing undergraduate studies in Greek, Latin, German, and mathematics at the University of Pennsylvania and graduate studies in linguistics at UCLA, He joined Google to work on human computation (crowdsourcing) in Ads, Research, and Machine Intelligence. he is particularly interested in empowering people everywhere to contribute unique insights from their daily experiences, which will make our products more humanistic and more representative of the diversity of the world.
Michael_Tseng.name: Michael Tseng
Michael_Tseng.title: Linguis

Thilina_Premasiri.bio: Thilina is an expert in game development who has spearheaded the development of Sri Lanka's first ever mainstream 3D game 'Kanchayudha' and currently works with Arimac on the 3D game development animations.
Thilina_Premasiri.name: Thilina Premasiri
Thilina_Premasiri.title: Director | Head of Game Development

He works as a Senior Tech Lead at 99X Technology (Pvt) Ltd, specializing in different software products. He is also a Microsoft MVP for developer technologies while He is the top contributor on Stack Overflow from Sri Lanka and ranks among the top 10 in the world for the tags angular, cosmosdb, etc. He makes use of his extensive knowledge over the past years to contribute to open source products to make the world a better place.

Sajeetharan_Sinnathurai.shortBio: Sajeetharan is a full stack developer with over 8 years of experience.

Ahmad_Shah.bio: Googler helping apps publishers in South Asia grow their businesses.Previosuly, he led Content and Digital services team at Telenor and oversaw the launch of internet-based services ( apps/ mobile responsive portals ) both in-house and in partnerships with publishers. Devised strategic blueprint for entertainment product partnerships and drove mobile4develpment (health, education and mAgriculture) agenda.Prior to Telenor, he graduated from the full-time MBA program at UCLA Anderson in July 2013, where he was US Fulbright Scholar. As Summer Associate for Adobe, Inc. he worked on Business Process Optimization project. Overall, he has over 6 years experience in cellular industry in various roles.His specialties are Product Management, Project Management, Content Acquistion,Product Marketing, Development, Market Analytics, Feasibility Research, Product Design, Cross-functional Leadership, Contract Negotiation, Obtaining Approvals

Ahmad_Shah.title: Head of Partnerships, South Asia Frontier

Fiqri_Ismail.bio: Fiqri is an Architect and Development Technologies Microsoft MVP for 12 consecutive years.He has more than 15 years of experience in the industry. His expertise expands in to various technologies such in .NET, C#, JavaScript, Delphi, PHP, Azure and Cloud Technologies. Also, he is the author of the book .NET Standard 2.0 Cookbook. Also Fiqri is the community leader, a speaker at Sri Lanka Developer Forum and writes articles on a variety of subjects on his personal blog.

Previously as an entrepreneur, sharatchandra has delivered a multitude of projects in the XR space.
Sharatchandra_Aithal.name: Sharatchandra Aithal

Sharatchandra_Aithal.title: Field Engineer

Chamantha_De_Silva.bio: Chamantha is currently working as a Technical Lead for SyscoLabs.Experienced, delivery-focused developer/development manager. Has designed and built successful enterprise API solutions, API Management solutions for Cake Corporation and Sysco. Furthermore, he has worked on surrounded technologies including areas such as securing services using OpenID Connect/SAML and OAuth2. Prior to SyscoLABS, Chamantha has built solutions for Thomson Reuters Health Care (now Truven Health Analytics) during his career in Virtusa Corporation. Currently playing a pivotal role as an evangelizer on product innovation and engineering in Sysco integration space Chamantha has a BSc in Computer Science from the Staffordshire University.
Chamantha_De_Silva.name: Chamantha De Silva
Chamantha_De_Silva.shortBio: Chamantha is currently working as a Technical Lead for SyscoLabs.
Chamantha_De_Silva.title: Technical Lead

Rohan_Jayaweera.bio: Rohan is currently the Country General Manager for Palo Alto Networks. The world’s leader in cyber security deliverying end to end security for organisations. Rohan is also a director of the only boutique & exclusive omni­channel digital experience management company ­ Antyra Solutions. Antyra Solutions is a unique digital services business in Sri Lanka with some of the most digitally demanding customers in it’s portfolio. Antyra delivers an end to end experience & a single point of accountability for customers on digital engagements.Before Antyra, Rohan’s most significant career position was being the first representative of Google for Sri Lanka. The work he started at Google he extended from Google onto Antyra with a more holistic view by helping brands, organizations and Sri Lanka government to develop its digital practices. As the Country Consultant at Google for Sri Lanka & Maldives he managed all engagements to and from Google for Sri Lanka during his tenure which included digital practice, policy framework, publisher, video & telco partnerships,community and entrepreneurship development. Rohan has deep understanding of channel/partner and eco­system business development having worked with technology brands. Rohan was a lead management consultant for IT sector based in Singapore & held leadership positions in Cisco, Lenovo & IBM across geographies. At early days he was awarded the prestigious award of head prefectship of Royal College.Rohan is passionate about entrepreneurship & Innovation. He is a key note speaker, presenter, moderator for countless events & was invited to speak at the inaugural TEDx in SL on entrepreneurship.
Rohan_Jayaweera.name: Rohan Jayaweera
Rohan_Jayaweera.shortBio: Rohan is currently the Country General Manager for Palo Alto Networks. The world’s leader in cyber security deliverying end to end security for organisations.
Rohan_Jayaweera.title: Country General Manager

Milindu_Sanoj.bio: Graduated with a BSc in Computer Science from University of Colombo School of Computing in 2017 and now working as a full-stack Software Engineer at Sysco Labs. Have been working with GDG Sri Lanka for about couple of years and now managing the GDG Cloud Sri Lanka chapter. Open source enthusiast and has contributed to Apache, Sahana and several other organisations.
Milindu_Sanoj.name: Milindu Sanoj
Milindu_Sanoj.shortBio: Graduated with a BSc in Computer Science from University of Colombo School of Computing in 2017 and now working as a full-stack Software Engineer at Sysco Labs.
Milindu_Sanoj.title: Software Engineer

Malinda_Rathnayake.bio: Malinda received his Bachelor of Engineering (B.Eng) in Software Engineering from the University of Westminster, UK. He has over 8 years of experience in different technological fields and currently work at Dialog Axiata, leading Ideamart platform development, IoT Research and Product Development. He is the co founder of Creacle - a software development startup and also worked as a contributor for Hanthana Linux. Malinda is the creator of slr.malindaprasad,com, the popular public train schedule website. He loves music, photography and his car KT 2019.
Malinda_Rathnayake.name: Malinda Rathnayake
